member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.Association
member.summary: Calculates the strength between pairs of variables or sets of variables. Can be used to detect link strengths.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.Association.Calculate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair},BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence,BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationOptions)
member.summary: Calculates the association/information between two sets of variables, such as those at either end of a Link.
member.param: The pairs to evaluate.
Any evidence.
Options affecting the calculations.
member.returns: The associations for each pair.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationOptions
member.summary: Options that affect the link strength algorithm.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationOptions.InferenceFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the inference factory used for link strength calculations.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationOutput
member.summary: Contains the results of an Association analysis.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationOutput.PairOutputs
member.summary: Gets the output for each pair.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair
member.summary: Defines two sets of variables to be analyzed by the Association algorithm.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair.#ctor(BayesServer.Variable,BayesServer.Variable)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with individual variables.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair.#ctor(BayesServer.Node,BayesServer.Node)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with individual nodes.
member.remarks: You can test the strength of a link by setting x = link.From and y= link.To.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable},System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with two sets of variables.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.VariableContext},System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.VariableContext})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with two sets of variable contexts.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair.X
member.summary: Gets the variable contexts in the first set.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPair.Y
member.summary: Gets the varible contexts in the second set.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput
member.summary: Contains the results of the association calculations between two sets of variables.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.Pair
member.summary: Gets the pair (X, Y) that these association results are calculated for.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.SymmetricMutualInformation
member.summary: Gets a normalized version of the mutual information called the 'symmetric uncertainty' between X and Y. 2 * I(X,Y) / (H(X) + H(Y))

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.ProficiencyXGivenY
member.summary: Gets the proficiency (uncertainty coefficient) U(X|Y) = I(X;Y) / H(X). This quantifies how much knowing Y can reduce the uncertainty in X.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.ProficiencyYGivenX
member.summary: Gets the proficiency (uncertainty coefficient) U(Y|X) = I(X;Y) / H(Y). This quantifies how much knowing X can reduce the uncertainty in Y.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.MutualInformation
member.summary: Gets the mutual information between X and Y, denoted I(X;Y).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.EntropyX
member.summary: Gets the entropy for X.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AssociationPairOutput.EntropyY
member.summary: Gets the entropy for Y.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsight
member.summary: Uses comparison queries to automatically derive insight about a target variable from a trained network.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsight.Calculate(BayesServer.State,System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable},BayesServer.Inference.IInferenceFactory)
member.summary: Uses comparison queries to automatically derive insight about a target variable from a trained network.
member.param: The variable state to derive insight about.
The variables that might impact the target.
A factory which can create inference engines. e.g. .
member.returns: The automatically derived insight.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsight.Calculate(BayesServer.State,System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable},BayesServer.Inference.IInferenceFactory,BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence)
member.summary: Uses comparison queries to automatically derive insight about a target variable from a trained network.
member.param: The variable state of interest to derive insight about.
The variables that might impact the target.
A factory which can create inference engines. e.g. .
Optional evidence which can be used to condition the insight calculations.
member.returns: The automatically derived insight.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsight.Calculate(BayesServer.Variable,System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Interval{System.Double}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable},BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence,BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOptions)
member.summary: Uses comparison queries to automatically derive insight about a target variable from a trained network.
member.param: The continuous variable to derive insight about.
The (ordered) intervals of the continuous target to test against.
The variables that might impact the target.
Optional evidence which can be used to condition the insight calculations.
Configuration options for the calculations.
member.returns: The automatically derived insight.

members.member:
Uses comparison queries to automatically derive insight about a target variable from a trained network.
The variable state to derive insight about. The variables that might impact the target. Optional evidence which can be used to condition the insight calculations. Configuration options for the calculations. /// The automatically derived insight.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightJSDivergence
member.summary: Determines the type of Jensen Shannon divergence calculations, if any, performed during an auto insight analysis.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightJSDivergence.None
member.summary: Jensen Shannon divergence is not calculated during the auto-insight analysis.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightJSDivergence.Simple
member.summary: When distributions are compared during the auto-insight process, marginal distributions, rather than joint distributions, are compared.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightKLDivergence
member.summary: Determines the type of KL divergence calculations, if any, performed during an auto insight analysis.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightKLDivergence.None
member.summary: KL divergence is not calculated during the auto-insight analysis.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightKLDivergence.Simple
member.summary: When distributions are compared during the auto-insight process, marginal distributions, rather than joint distributions, are compared.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOptions
member.summary: Options that affect auto-insight calculations.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOptions.InferenceFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the inference factory used for link strength calculations.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOptions.Sampling
member.summary: Options affecting sampling, when approximate inference is required.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOptions.KLDivergence
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines the type of KL divergence calculations to perform, if any.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOptions.JSDivergence
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines the type of Jensen Shannon divergence calculations to perform, if any.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOutput
member.summary: Contains the results obtained from .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOutput.Target
member.summary: Gets the target state used to calculate the insight.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOutput.ContinuousTargetInterval
member.summary: Gets the target interval (if any). This will be only be set for continuous targets.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOutput.IsApproximate
member.summary: Gets a value which when true indicates that the auto-insight calculations were approximated using sampling.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOutput.TargetProbability
member.summary: Gets the probability of the target state, given any optional background evidence.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightOutput.VariableOutputs
member.summary: Contains the insights from each test variable.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightSamplingOptions
member.summary: Options that affect any sampling required during auto-insight calculations.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightSamplingOptions.SampleCount
member.summary: The number of samples used to approximate sufficient statistics, when exact inference is not possible.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutput
member.summary: Contains the results obtained from for each test variable.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutput.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent collection.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutput.State
member.summary: Gets the state this insight refers to.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutput.ProbabilityTargetGivenThis
member.summary: Gets the probability of the target state given this state.
member.remarks: Note that auto insight can be called with background evidence set on certain variables, in which case this result includes that evidence.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutput.Probability
member.summary: Gets the probability of this state with no evidence set on the target state.
member.remarks: Note that auto insight can be called with background evidence set on certain variables, in which case this is the probability given that evidence alone.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutput.ProbabilityGivenTarget
member.summary: Gets the probability of this state given the target state.
member.remarks: Note that auto insight can be called with background evidence set on certain variables, in which case this is the probability given that evidence and the target.

members.member:
Gets the ratio of the probability of this state given the target state over the probability of this state excluding the target state.
Note that auto insight can be called with background evidence set on certain variables, in which case these values will be conditioned on that evidence also.
.

Gets the difference between the probability of this state given the target state and the probability of this state excluding the target state.
Note that auto insight can be called with background evidence set on certain variables, in which case these values will be conditioned on that evidence also.
.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutputCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of instances.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightStateOutputCollection.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent variable output.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput
member.summary: Represents the output obtained from for a test variable.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent collection.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput.ProbabilityGivenTarget
member.summary: Gets the distribution of this variable given the target.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput.StateOutputs
member.summary: Gets the insight for each state of this test variable.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput.KLDivergence
member.summary: Gets the Kullback-Leibler divergence for the test distribution, and tells us how much the test variance changes with the hypothesis.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput.JSDivergenceBits
member.summary: Gets the Jensen Shannon divergence for the test distribution, measured in BITS.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutput.Variable
member.summary: Gets the test variable.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutputCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of instances.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.AutoInsightVariableOutputCollection.Parent
member.summary: Gets the main output.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCount
member.summary: Methods to determine the number of clusters (discrete states of a latent variable).
Determine the number of clusters (discrete states of a latent variable) using cross validation.
member.param: The Bayesian network.
The cluster (discrete latent variable) to test.
Different cluster counts to test. Include 1 to test for no cluster variable.
Requires a method that can learn the parameters of a copy of .
Requires a method that can create an evidence reader command for a copy of
Options affecting how the tests are performed.
member.returns: The number of clusters, and supplementary information.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOptions
member.summary: Options used by .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOptions.RunsPerConfiguration
member.summary: Gets of sets the number of times training is re-run for each network structure tested.
member.remarks: The higher the number, the longer the tests will take, but the tests will be more accurate.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOptions.Partitions
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of cross validation partitions to use.
member.remarks: The higher the number, the longer the tests will take.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOptions.InferenceFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the factory which is used to create inference engines during the cluster count tests.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOptions.EnsureTestWithoutCluster
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether a test must be included which excludes the cluster variable altogether. (i.e. a test with a single cluster).
member.remarks: It may be the case that a cluster (latent variable) is not warrented at all, which this test can detect.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOutput
member.summary: Output information returned from .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOutput.Scores
member.summary: A list of scores, one for each cluster count in the same order passed to .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterCountOutput.BestToWorst
member.summary: A list of scores, sorted from best to worst.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterScore
member.summary: Contains the results of a cluster configuration returned from .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterScore.ClusterCount
member.summary: The number of clusters used to generate this score.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ClusterScore.Score
member.summary: The score achieved for this number of clusters.
member.remarks: This is the log-likelihood calculated using cross-validation. Higher scores are better.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.CombinationOptions
member.summary: Determines which combinations are generated by .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.CombinationOptions.EnumerateMissing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether null/missing values should be enumerated in addition to each state.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.CombinationOptions.EnumerateAllMissing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether the combination where all states are null/missing should be included in the enumeration.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.Combinations
member.summary: Generates the available state combinations for a set of variables or counts.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.Combinations.Enumerate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable},System.Action{System.Nullable{System.Int32}[]},BayesServer.Analysis.CombinationOptions)
member.summary: Enumerates the state combinations for a set of variables.
member.param: The variables to generate state combinations for.
Options affecting which combinations are generated.
Called for each combination with an array (re-used for each call) of zero based indexes for each variable. An index can be null (depending on ), if the state is unknown.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.Combinations.Enumerate(System.Int32[],System.Action{System.Nullable{System.Int32}[]},BayesServer.Analysis.CombinationOptions)
member.summary: Enumerates the combinations for a set of counts.
member.param: The counts to generate combinations for.
Options affecting which combinations are generated.
Called for each combination with an array (re-used for each call) of zero based indexes for each count. An index can be null (depending on ), if the state is null/unknown.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix
member.summary: Calculates a confusion matrix for a network which is used to predict discrete values (classification).

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix.Create(BayesServer.Data.IDataReaderCommand,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Returns the data containing the actual values and predicted values.
The name of the data column containing the actual value.
The name of the data column containing the predicted value.
The case weight, if any. Can be null.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix.CorrectCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of correct predictions.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix.TotalCount
member.summary: Gets a count of the number of predictions, whether they were correct or not.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix.GetAccuracy
member.summary: Gets the overall accuracy of the predictions, which is simply the divided by the .
member.returns: The accuracy which is a value between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix.GetCell(System.IComparable,System.IComparable)
member.summary: Gets information about a cell in a confusion matrix.
member.param: The actual value we want information about.
The predicted value we want information about.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrix.GetSortedUniqueValues
member.summary: Gets a sorted list of unique values which is the union of the different actual and predicted values found.
member.returns: A sorted list of values.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrixCell
member.summary: Contains statistics about a cell in a .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrixCell.Count
member.summary: Gets the count (support) for this cell. This is the number of cases that have been classified as belonging to this cell.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrixCell.Probability
member.summary: Gets the overall probability for this cell. This is the proportion of cases that have been classified as belonging to this cell.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrixCell.ProbabilityGivenActual
member.summary: Gets the probability for this cell, conditional on the actual counts.
member.remarks: For binary classifiers, the terms recall rate/sensitivity/true positive rate/specificity/true negative rate are sometimes used to refer to particular cells.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ConfusionMatrixCell.ProbabilityGivenPredicted
member.summary: Gets the probability for this cell, conditional on the predicted counts.
member.remarks: For binary classifiers, the terms precision/positive predicted value, are sometimes used to refer to particular cells.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparation
member.summary: Contains methods to calculate D-Separation.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparation.Calculate(BayesServer.Network,System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Node},System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Node},BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence,BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationOptions)
member.summary: Calculates whether sets of nodes are D-Separated, given any evidence.
member.param: The Bayesian network.
A set of nodes, which if changed (new evidence set), may or may not affect the test nodes.
The nodes we are testing to see if they would be effected by new evidence on any of the source nodes.
Any existing evidence.
Options governing the calculations.
member.returns: An instance which contains the d-separation results for each test node.

member.summary: Calculates whether sets of nodes are D-Separated, given any evidence, and associated times for any temporal nodes.
member.param: The Bayesian network.
A set of nodes, which if changed (new evidence set), may or may not affect the test nodes.
Any times associated with the test nodes.
The nodes we are testing to see if they would be effected by new evidence on any of the source nodes.
Any times associated with the test nodes.
Any existing evidence.
Options governing the calculations.
member.returns: An instance which contains the d-separation results for each test node.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationCategory
member.summary: The result of a D-Separation test.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationCategory.DSeparated
member.summary: The test node is D-Separated from the source nodes.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationCategory.DConnected
member.summary: The test node is D-Connected to the source nodes.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationCategory.FullyInstantiated
member.summary: The test node has hard evidence set on all of its variables.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationOptions.TerminalTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the terminal time, which is the time at which any terminal nodes in a Dynamic Bayesian Network connect to temporal nodes.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationTestResult.Time

member.summary: The test result.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.DSeparationTestResultCollection

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOptions.KeepEvidenceNotAnalyzed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which when true retains evidence not being analysed, or when false ignores it.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines whether evidence subsets are included, excluded or both.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of evidence subsets to consider.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOptions.Factory
member.summary: Gets or sets the inference factory which is used to create inference engines during an impact analysis.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutput
member.summary: Contains the results of an Impact analysis.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutput.Items
member.summary: Gets the output for each combination.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutput.Hypothesis
member.summary: Gets output information for the hypothesis variable/state.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem
member.summary: The output from an impact analysis, for a particular subset of evidence.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.EvidenceFlags
member.summary: Gets a list of values each of which indicate which of the evidence being analyzed is set.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.StateProbability
member.summary: Gets the probability of the hypothesis state (if specified) for this output item evidence.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.StateThisDiffNone
member.summary: Gets the probability of the hypothesis state (if specified) for this evidence configuration minus the state probability with no evidence to analyze.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.StateAllDiffThis
member.summary: Gets the probability of the hypothesis state (if specified) with all evidence to analyze minus the state probability for this evidence configuration.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.StateThisLiftNone
member.summary: Gets the probability of the hypothesis state (if specified) for this evidence configuration relative to when no evidence to analyze is set. Also known as the normalized likelihood.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.StateAllLiftThis
member.summary: Gets the probability of the hypothesis state (if specified) when all evidence to analyze is set relative to when this evidence configuration is set.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.KLDivergenceFromNone
member.summary: Gets the Kullback-Leibler divergence D(P||Q) from the hypothesis query without evidence to analyze set (Q) to the current combination (P).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactOutputItem.KLDivergenceToAll
member.summary: Gets the Kullback-Leibler divergence D(P||Q) from the hypothesis query with the current subset of evidence (Q) to all evidence to analyze set (P).

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactSubsetMethod
member.summary: Determines how subsets are determined during impact analysis.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactSubsetMethod.Include
member.summary: The maximum subset size is the maximum size of the subset of evidence being analyzed.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.ImpactSubsetMethod.Exclude
member.summary: The maximum subset size is the maximum size of the subset of evidence being analyzed that is excluded.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetection
member.summary: Detects in-sample anomalies in a data set.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetection.Learn(BayesServer.Network,BayesServer.Data.IEvidenceReaderCommandFactory,System.Action{BayesServer.Network,BayesServer.Data.IEvidenceReaderCommand},BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOptions)
member.summary: Build the in-sample anomaly detector, which can be used to remove anomalous data from a training data set.
member.param: An instance which can create evidence reader commands which may be partitioned.
A callback which can learn the parameters of a network.
The network structure to use to for the anomaly detection model. This can be a simple mixture model (cluster model) of a more complicated model.
Options affecting how the detector is learned.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetection.Test(BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence)
member.summary: Determines whether a record is anomalous. Typically a record is from the in-sample data used to train this instance.
member.param: Evidence to test.
member.returns: An output instance which indicates whether the record is anomalous.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOptions
member.summary: Options used by .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOptions.Partitions
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of cross validation partitions to use.
member.remarks: The higher the number, the longer the tests will take.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOptions.InferenceFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the factory which is used to create inference engines during the in-sample anomaly detection process.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOutput
member.summary: Output used by .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOutput.AnomalyScore
member.summary: Gets a value between [0, 1] with values closer to 0 being more likely to be anomalous.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOutput.IsAnomalous
member.summary: Determines whether the record is deemed anomalous.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.InSampleAnomalyDetectionOutput.IsAnomalous(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Determines whether the record is deemed anomalous.
member.param: Used as a threshold to determine whether a record is anomalous or not. A value of 0.0 would only catch the most extreme anomalies. A value of 1.0 would mark everything as anomalous. Leave as null to use an appropriate default.
member.returns: true if the record is deemed anomalous, false otherwise.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart
member.summary: Represents a lift chart, used to measure predictive performance.
member.remarks:
Lift charts are used to measure the predictive performance of a classification network, and tell us how the model compares to a random model and the ideal model.
Lift charts are particularly useful when the probabilities of correct classification are low, such as when predicting rare events or anomalies. In these circumstances, a confusion matrix may give very high accuracy simply because most cases are not rare events or anomalies and hence correctly predicted. A lift chart however can take small probabilities into account to assess the improvement (lift) in prediction of these rare events or anomalies.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.IComparable,BayesServer.Data.IDataReaderCommand)
member.summary: Creates a lift chart, used to measure predictive performance.
member.param: The name of the data column containing the actual classification.
The name of the data column which contains the predicted probability generated by an inference query.
Optional case weight. Can be null.
The target value of interest. E.g. True if we are interested in predicting Purchase=True.
The predictions.
member.returns: A lift chart.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.Score
member.summary: Gets the overall score, which is a positive or negative probability between 0 and 1 indicating the classification performance of the network.

remarks.para: Score = (area under predicted - area under random) / (area under ideal - area under random)
A score of 0 indicates that the predictive performance is no better than random.
A score of 1 indicates the network perfectly predicts all cases.
A negative score indicates the network performs worse than random, which may indicate incorrect usage.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.Actual
member.summary: Gets the name of the data column containing the actual classification.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.Ideal
member.summary: Gets the population probability value at which the target reaches 100 %.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.Points
member.summary: Gets the xy points that make up the lift chart.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.PredictedProbability
member.summary: Gets the name of the data column which contains the predicted probability generated by an inference query.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChart.TargetValue
member.summary: Gets the target value which we are interested in.
member.remarks: For example, for a variable 'Purchase' with state values True and False, if we are trying to predict whether someone will make a purchase or not, the target value would be True.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChartPoint
member.summary: Represents an XY coordinate in a lift chart.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChartPoint.X
member.summary: Gets the value on the x-axis.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.LiftChartPoint.Y
member.summary: Gets the value on the y-axis.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ParameterTuning
member.summary: Calculates how a parameter can be updated so that the resulting value of a hypothesis is within a given range.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ParameterTuning.OneWaySimple(BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay,BayesServer.Interval{System.Double})
member.summary: Given a sensitivity function, determines how the parameter under consideration can be altered so that the resulting value of the hypothesis is within a given range.
member.param: The sensitivity function.
A goal/range we would like the hypothesis probability to lie within.
member.returns: The interval for the parameter which satisfies the desired hypothesis constraint/range.
member.exception: Raised if the constraint is already satisfied.
Raised if the constraint cannot be satisfied.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ParameterTuning.OneWayDifference(BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay,BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay,BayesServer.Interval{System.Double})
member.summary: Given a pair of sensitivity functions (evaluated on the same parameter and evidence but different hypotheses), determines how the parameter under consideration can be altered so that the difference between the hypothesis probabilities P(h1|e) - P(h2|e) is within a given range.
member.param: The first sensitivity function.
The second sensitivity function.
A goal/range we would like P(h1|e) - P(h2|e) to lie within.
member.returns: The interval for the parameter which satisfies the goal.
member.exception: Raised if the constraint is already satisfied.
Raised if the constraint cannot be satisfied.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ParameterTuning.OneWayRatio(BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay,BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay,BayesServer.Interval{System.Double})
member.summary: Given a pair of sensitivity functions (evaluated on the same parameter and evidence but different hypotheses), determines how the parameter under consideration can be altered so that the ratio between the hypothesis probabilities P(h1|e) / P(h2|e) is within a given range.
member.param: The first sensitivity function.
The second sensitivity function.
A goal/range we would like P(h1|e) / P(h2|e) to lie within.
member.returns: The interval for the parameter which satisfies the goal.
member.exception: Raised if the constraint is already satisfied.
Raised if the constraint cannot be satisfied.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ParameterTuningOneWay
member.summary: Represents the result of one way parameter tuning.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ParameterTuningOneWay.Interval
member.summary: Gets the interval for the parameter which satisfies the constraint used in parameter tuning.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The name of the data column containing the actual value.
The name of the data column containing the predicted value.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.Create(BayesServer.Data.IDataReaderCommand,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Returns the data containing the actual values and predicted values.
The name of the data column containing the actual value.
The name of the data column containing the predicted value.
The case weight, if any. Can be null.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.MeanAbsoluteError
member.summary: Gets the mean absolute error (MAE), which is a common measure used to determine how close predictions are to the actual values.
member.remarks: The mean absolute error is the average of the absolute errors.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.MeanSquaredError
member.summary: Gets the mean squared error (MSE), which is a common measure used to determine how close predictions are to the actual values.
member.remarks: The mean squared error is the average of the squared errors.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.SumSquaredError
member.summary: Gets the sum of squared errors (SSE), which is a common measure used to determine how close predictions are to the actual values.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.RMSE
member.summary: Gets the root mean squared error (RMSE).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.MeanActual
member.summary: Gets the mean of the actual column.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.VarianceActual
member.summary: Gets the variance of the actual column.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.RSquared
member.summary: Gets the R squared value (Coefficient of determination).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.RegressionStatistics.Support
member.summary: Gets the support/weight for the values used to calculate the statistics. (May not be a whole number, if original weights are not).

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay
member.summary: Represents the result on a one-way sensitivity to parameters analysis. The sensitivity function = P(h|e)(t) where h is the hypothesis state, e is the evidence, and t is the parameter being analyzed.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.Evaluate(System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates the Sensitivity function P(h|e)(t) = (alpha * t + beta) / (gamma * t + delta)
member.param: The parameter value at which to evaluate the function.
member.returns: The value of the sensitivity function P(h|e)(t).

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.EvaluateDeriv(System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates the partial derivative of the Sensitivity function with respect to t = ((alpha*delta)-(beta*gamma))/((gamma*t + delta)^2)
member.param: The parameter value at which to evaluate the derivative.
member.returns: The value of the derivative of the sensitivity function dP(h|e)/dt.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the original value of the parameter being analyzed.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.ProbabilityHypothesisGivenEvidence
member.summary: Gets P(h|e).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.SensitivityValue
member.summary: Gets the sensitivity value which is the derivative of the sensitivity function evaluated at t.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.Alpha
member.summary: Gets Alpha from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.Beta
member.summary: Gets Beta from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.Gamma
member.summary: Gets Gamma from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionOneWay.Delta
member.summary: Gets Delta from the sensitivity function.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay
member.summary: Represents the result on a two-way sensitivity to parameters analysis. The sensitivity function = P(h|e)(t1, t2) where h is the hypothesis state, e is the evidence, and t1 and t2 are the the parameters being analyzed.
member.remarks: The sensitivity function is defined as P(h|e)(t1,t2) = (alpha1 * t1 * t2 + beta1 * t1 + gamma1 * t2 + delta1) / (alpha2 * t1 * t2 + beta2 * t1 + gamma2 * t2 + delta2)

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.ParameterValue1
member.summary: Gets the original value of the first parameter being analyzed (t1).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.ParameterValue2
member.summary: Gets the original value of the second parameter being analyzed (t2).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.ProbabilityHypothesisGivenEvidence
member.summary: Gets P(h|e).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Alpha1
member.summary: Gets Alpha1 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Alpha2
member.summary: Gets Alpha2 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Beta1
member.summary: Gets Beta1 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Beta2
member.summary: Gets Beta2 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Gamma1
member.summary: Gets Gamma1 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Gamma2
member.summary: Gets Gamma2 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Delta1
member.summary: Gets Delta1 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.SensitivityFunctionTwoWay.Delta2
member.summary: Gets Delta2 from the sensitivity function.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformation
member.summary: Contains methods to determine what new evidence is most likely to reduce the uncertainty of a variable.

remarks.para: Value of information is useful when you have a particular variable of interest (the hypothesis variable) and you want to know what additional evidence is most likely to reduce the uncertainty of that variable.

For example in a medical troubleshooter, you may wish to know which questions to ask or which medical checks to carry out first, in order to determine whether the patient has a particular disease or not.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformation.Calculate(BayesServer.Variable,System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.Variable},BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence,BayesServer.Inference.IInferenceFactory,BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationOptions)
member.summary: Calculates value of information, which can be used to determine which variables are most likely to reduce the uncertainty of a particular variable.
member.remarks: See for more information.
member.param: The variable whose uncertaintly you are trying to reduce. E.g. for fault diagnosis / troubleshooting.
The variables you wish to consider in order to reduce the uncertainty of the hypothesis variable.
Any evidence, which can be null.
Determines the type of inference engine to use during the calculations.
Options affecting how value of information is calculated.
member.returns: Information about how the influence the variable.
member.exception: Raised when the hypothesis distribution cannot be calculated given the evidence.

member.name: M:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformation.Calculate(BayesServer.VariableContext,System.Collections.Generic.IList{BayesServer.VariableContext},BayesServer.Inference.IEvidence,BayesServer.Inference.IInferenceFactory,BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationOptions)
member.summary: Calculates value of information, which can be used to determine which variables are most likely to reduce the uncertainty of a particular variable.
member.remarks: See for more information.
member.param: The variable (and time for temporal variables) whose uncertaintly you are trying to reduce. E.g. for fault diagnosis / troubleshooting.
The variables (and associated times for temporal variables) you wish to consider in order to reduce the uncertainty of the hypothesis variable.
Any evidence, which can be null.
Determines the type of inference engine to use during the calculations.
Options affecting how value of information is calculated.
member.returns: Information about how the influence the variable.
member.exception: Raised when the hypothesis distribution cannot be calculated given the evidence.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationKind
member.summary: The type of value of information statistic calculated.

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationKind.MEU
member.summary: The maximum expected utility of a decision node given the test and any other evidence,

member.name: F:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationKind.MutualInformation
member.summary: The mutual information between the hypothesis and the test, given any evidence.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationOptions

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationOptions.TerminalTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the terminal time, which is the time at which any terminal nodes in a Dynamic Bayesian Network connect to temporal nodes.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationOutput.HypothesisStatistic
member.summary: Gets the statistic associated with the hypothesis before any test variables have evidence set.
member.remarks: If the hypothesis variable is a discrete probability variable, the test statistic used is entropy (base e). If the hypothesis variable is a decision node, the test statistics is Maximum Expected Utility (MEU).

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationOutput.TestOutputs
member.summary: Gets the result of tests carried out on the test variables.
member.remarks: Each test result indicates how likely it is that the test variable reduces the uncertainty of the hypothesis variable.

member.name: T:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationTestOutput
member.summary: Contains information about a variable tested via .

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationTestOutput.Variable
member.summary: Gets the variable that was tested.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationTestOutput.Kind
member.summary: Gets the type of Value of information statistic calculated.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationTestOutput.HypothesisStatistic
member.summary: Gets the statistic for the hypothesis given knowledge on this test variable.
member.remarks: When is MutualInformation, the statistic is MutualInformation, and when it is MEU, this statistic is the Maximum expected utility of the hypothesis decision.

member.name: P:BayesServer.Analysis.ValueOfInformationTestOutput.HypothesisImprovement
member.summary: Gets the improvement between the hypothesis statistic when we do not have knowledge about this test variable and when we do.
member.remarks: This is only reported for changes in discrete mutual information and maximum expected utility.
